Xie Zi Jing Review - Empires & Puzzles Journey Family Hero Strategy Guide
Is the Scorpion Demoness still deadly in 2026? We dive deep into Xie Zi Jing's kit to see if her uncleanseable poison and priority dispel can still pierce through the modern meta's defenses.
Xie Zi Jing: The Scorpion Queen's Poisonous Sting
Xie Zi Jing: The "Anti-BS" Scorpion Queen Who Melts Dodgers

Xie Zi Jing, often dubbed the "Scorpion Demoness" (or just the Scorpion Lady by the community), is a 5-star Dark (Purple) hero from the Journey family, originally released during the 2024 Lunar New Year event. She arrived as a direct answer to the dodge-heavy meta dominated by heroes like Costumed Kadilen and Bastet. As a Fighter class hero, she has the tenacity to revive and keep applying pressure. While her stats have aged, her unique toolkit—specifically the ability to ignore dodge, dispel
hitting, and apply uncleanseable poison—keeps her relevant in specific niche scenarios.

The artwork is... certainly memorable. While some players expected a seductive demoness in the vein of Diaochan, we got a literal half-woman, half-scorpion hybrid that looks like she woke up on the wrong side of the arachnid bed. The intense expression and the sheer number of limbs make her look ready to tear through defenses—or at least complain to the manager about them. It's a stark, monstrous departure from the more "human" Journey heroes, fitting for a character whose nickname is literally "Scorpion Spirit."
Let's be blunt: Xie Zi Jing's stats are showing their age.
Once considered high, this is now well below the average for modern attackers, who regularly push 1300+ base attack.
These durability stats are fragile by modern standards. Modern tanks and bruisers sit at 1300 Defense and 2500+ Health.
Even with a second Limit Break, her stats (~1264 Atk / 1203 Def / 2133 HP) barely catch up to the
stats of heroes released in late 2025. She relies entirely on her mechanic utility rather than raw stat-checking.
"Wrathful Sting" is a technical marvel designed to dismantle specific defenses.
This is her headline feature. Unlike most heroes who can miss against a dodge buff, Xie Zi Jing
connects. This makes her a hard counter to C.Kadilen, Bastet, and the myriad of Rogue/Glass passives.
She dispels buffs from the target and nearby enemies
dealing her DoT. This removes Taunt (unless it's undispellable), Defense Up, or Ailment Immunity buffs (like Aramis or Hathor) before they can protect the team.
Note: She does not deal direct damage, so she won't trigger "damage on hit" passives, but also won't kill low HP enemies instantly.
1257 damage over 3 turns is massive (~419 per turn). Because it's uncleanseable, once it lands, the enemy
take that damage unless they have ailment immunity beforehand (which she might dispel) or passive resistance.
Let's break down the math behind the sting.

. She requires 8 tiles to charge. With a lvl 29 mana troop or a Magic troop, she can charge in 7 tiles. Her passive gives her a 50% chance to gain 10% mana when receiving a buff, allowing her to potentially charge in just
0. She deals no direct impact damage.
If the duration extends to 6 turns (100% chance), the damage potential doubles to
. This is team-wiping potential if stalled.
The 50% chance for 10% Mana/Health on buff receipt significantly increases her effective speed and sustain. In a team with buffers like C.Hathor or Nautica, she can chain specials rapidly.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Journey family is all about momentum and extending the suffering of your enemies.

This is arguably the strongest part of her kit if you commit to the family. With 2 or 3 Journey heroes, you have a 75-100% chance to extend her poison to 4, 5, or 6 turns. A 6-turn uncleanseable poison is practically a death sentence for the enemy team, draining over 2500 HP slowly while they can do nothing about it.
These passives turn her into a self-sustaining engine.
Essential for cutting tile requirements. Pair her with heroes that buff continuously (e.g., Hulda, C.Hathor) to make her functionally "Very Fast."
Provides passive healing, mitigating her lower base health pool.

. A decent defensive tool. Since she is likely to be targeted due to her threat level, reflecting 60% damage helps chip down attackers. It's not as game-breaking as "Dodge" or "Ailment Immunity," but it adds some punishment to AoE hitters.

Upon release, Xie Zi Jing was a terror. The combination of ignoring dodge and high uncleanseable damage made her a staple in top-tier defenses, often flanked by other Journey heroes. She was the answer to the "Dodge Meta."

Her stats have fallen off a cliff. Modern heroes have 30-40% higher survivability. Furthermore, the rise of "Toon" passives (75% chance to resist ailments) hurts her significantly, as her primary damage source can be completely ignored by a lucky passive roll.
She is no longer a top-tier defender. On offense, however, she remains a
. You bring her specifically to delete C.Kadilen teams, dispel taunts, or melt high-defense teams that lack ailment immunity. She is a scalpel, not a hammer.
At the time of writing, Xie Zi Jing does not have a costume. If one is released, expect it to update her stats to modern standards and potentially add direct damage to her special skill.
As a Fighter, she can revive, which synergizes perfectly with her DoT role (revive -> DoT continues ticking).
Maximizes the Poison DoT damage. DoT scales with the Attack stat, so every node increases the guaranteed damage she deals.
Leaves her already fragile stats even more exposed. She might die before firing.
Ensures she survives long enough to fire her special at least once. Utilizes the Fighter revive talent more effectively by keeping her in the fight.
Slightly lower poison damage per turn.
path is recommended. Her poison is deadly enough at base; the priority is ensuring she lives through the alpha strike of modern 1300% snipers to actually use it.
Ignores dodge buffs 100% of the time.
Removes defensive buffs (Taunt, Defense Up) before applying ailments.
Once the poison sticks, it's guaranteed damage (bypassing cleansers).
Becomes exponentially stronger with other Journey heroes.
Can be one-shot by modern snipers.
Cannot finish off a low HP enemy instantly; they might fire one last time before the poison tick kills them.
"Toon" passives, Monks, and Clerics can resist/withstand the poison application, rendering her turn wasted.
Heroes like Aramis or updated Gargoyles who prevent ailments entirely (undispellable) shut her down if they fire first.
Specifically against Dodge tanks or teams relying on buff-heavy defenses.
She shines here. Since healing is disabled, her uncleanseable poison is permanent damage that cannot be recovered.
Her passives grant her mana and health for every buff, making her incredibly fast and durable in this mode.
Xie Zi Jing is not a "plug and play" hero; she needs a team that supports her mechanics.
Xie Zi Jing + Sha Wujing + Chang'e
Activates the 3-hero family bonus. XZJ's poison extends to 6 turns. Sha Wujing provides healing and dodge. Chang'e prevents enemy buffs. This trio was once the strongest defense in the game.
C.Hathor and Nautica provide constant buffs. XZJ's passive triggers constantly, feeding her mana and health, allowing her to fire every 2-3 turns.
. Don't pair her with other Poison heroes (like C.Sartana) unless you time them carefully, as the weaker poison might overwrite the stronger one.

If you pull her, level her! A fast dispeller who bypasses dodge solves many difficult map stages and raid puzzles. She doesn't need high troops to be effective, as her mana passive helps her charge. Focus on keeping her alive.

She is a luxury tool. Do not put her on defense; she is free food for Toon attackers. Use her on offense to dismantle C.Kadilen/Bastet teams. Do not spend Alpha Aethers on her unless you use her daily in wars; her stats gain from LB2 isn't enough to make her a tank, and her utility works fine at LB1.
"She looks like an unreasonable auntie unable to get her way at a market sale!" -

"People are complaining about this?! Fast 900 damage to all... Guaranteed and without any possibility to avoid it via counterattack, dodge or ailment immunity buff?! And fighter class?! You guys are funny!" -
Players were initially confused why she was a literal scorpion monster while others were human. "I was not expecting The Rock’s scorpion king form."

Xie Zi Jing remains the queen of "No." Dodge? No. Taunt? No. Cleanse? No. While her stats have been eroded by the sands of time (and power creep), her ability to bypass the most annoying defensive mechanics in the game ensures she will always have a spot on the bench for specific wars. She isn't the meta-defining monster she was in 2024, but when you see a dodge team, you'll be glad you have the Scorpion Auntie on speed dial.
A specialized scalpel for offense. Bench for defense.
(Costume note: Still waiting for that makeover, SG!)
